Description: SysBio VEOIBD Clinical Metadata Template
Identifying string linked to the individual or animal being studied, formatted as [site prefix] + [localID]
Identifying string linked to the family being studied
Site at which the participant was recruited
The role of the study participant within the family group
The type of sibling. If participantRole=sibling, specify sibling type.
The biological sex of the study participant
The age of the participant at diagnosis in years
VEOIBD phenotype code indicating the GI diagnosis
Does the study participant have an immunodeficiency diagnosis?
Does the study participant have a known autoimmune condition?
Please specify which autoimmune disease the participant has, if any.
The location of GI disease or activity pertinent to VEOIBD study
Valid Values: L1,L1. Ileal,L2,L2. Colonic,L3,L3. Ileocolonic,L4,L4*. Isolated upper disease,E1,E1. Ulcerative proctitis,E2,E2. Left-sided uc,E3,E3. Extensive,E4,E4. Pancolitis

Description: The type of upper GI disease. If diseaseActivityLocation=upper disease, please specify.
Valid Values: L4a,L4a. Upper disease proximal to ligament of treitz,L4b,L4b. Upper disease distal to ligament of treitz & proximal to distal 3rd ileum

Description: The behavior of GI disease
Valid Values: Non-stricturing and non-penetrating,Stricturing,Penetrating,Both penetrating and stricturing,Never severe,Ever severe,Unknown

Description: Has the study participant experienced growth delay?
Is there perianal involvement?
Is there a history of extraintestinal manifestations?
Has the study participant undergone any GI surgeries?
Please specify which GI surgeries the participant has undergone, if any.
Does the study participant have a family history of IBD?
The country of birth of the study participant

Description: Is the study participant the offspring of a relationship between biologically-related individuals?
A geographic ancestral origin category that is assigned to a population group based mainly on physical characteristics that are thought to be distinct and inherent.
Population category defined using ancestry informative markers (AIMs) based on genetic/genomic data
Is the study participant of Jewish origin?
Was the study participant breastfed?
The duration of breastfeeding in months, if the study participant was breastfed.
Was the study participant exposed to second hand smoke in the period 6 months prior to diagnosis?
Is the individual part of the RC2 cohort?
SysBio VEOIBD Biospecimen template schema
Identifying string linked to a particular sample or specimen. For RC2 Samples: formatted as [IndividualID] + [Sample Type Abbreviation] + [Sample letter key] + [Subcategory of analysis type]

Key indicating additional information about samples. Should match key found in RC2 Sample ID. For biopsy: suggested location, inflammation status, and preservation method. For blood: blood component, preservation method.
Funding source used to support sampling. May be necessary information to determine scope of sharing permissions.
The type of sample being described
Biopsy actual location
Biopsy inflammation status
The number of biopsies
The method of preservation for biopsy samples
The volume of serum, PBMC, PAX collected
The units the volume is reported in
The number of cells for PBMC samples as # x 10^6
The date sample was collected in format YYYY-MM-DD
The general diagnosis category
Any additional notes about the biospecimen
Tracking number issued by vendor. this can be used to identify shipping "batches" i.e. samples that were shipped at the same time under the same conditions
The vendor used to ship biosamples
Sample originator. Should match prefix on RC2 Sample ID
The unique ID, if there is one that is separate from the specimen ID (for example, if sites use their own internal unique ID). Some sites may collect this but not all
Library ID as provided by the lab
The technology used to generate the data in this file
The specific version (manufacturer, model, etc.) of a technology that is used to carry out a laboratory or computational experiment.
Valid Values: HiSeqX,HiSeq4000,Illumina_1M,HiSeq3000,HiSeq2500,DNBSEQ,HiSeq1000,GAIIx,Illumina_h650,ddSEQ Single-Cell Isolator,confocalImaging,Bruker Avance III,Bionano Irys,Biograph mCT,HiSeq2000,Illumina_HumanOmni1-Quadv1.0,Illumina_Omni5M,Illumina MouseWG-6 v2.0 expression beadchip,IlluminaNovaseq6000,IlluminaWholeGenomeDASL,Infinium Global Diversity Array-8,Illumina_Infinium-HumanMethylation450-BeadChip,IlluminaInfiniumGSAMD-24v2-0,IlluminaMethylationEPIC,PacBioRSII,IlluminaHumanMethylation450,IlluminaHumanHT-12_V3_0_R1,IlluminaHumanHap650Yv3_A,IlluminaHumanHap300,Illumina_Omni5-Quad,Biocrates p180,Illumina_Omni2pt5M,Illumina_Omni2.5-8_v1.3,Illumina_Omni2.5-8_v1.1,Illumina_Omni2.5-8,llumina Infinium General Screening Array 24-Kit v3.0,BGISEQ-500,Perlegen300Karray,AffymetrixU133Plus2,orbitrap,Xevo TQ-S,Agilent44Karray,NextSeq2000,NextSeq500,NanostringnCounter_MouseADPanel,NanostringnCounter,MiSeq,LTQOrbitrapXL,InfiniumPsychArrayBeadChip,Infinium Omni2.5Exome-8 v1.5,Infinium Omni2.5Exome-8 v1.4,Infinium Omni2.5Exome-8 v1.3,Infinium Omni2.5Exome-8 v1.1,Infinium HumanOmniExpressExome,OrbiTrap Fusion,Orbitrap Fusion Lumos,Olink Target 96,triple quadrupole,AffymetrixU133AB,Affymetrix Human Gene 1.0 ST Array,PacBio Sequel II,Xevo G2 QTOF,PsychChip,Affy6.0,Affy5.0,Illumina NovaSeq 6000,Q Exactive HF,Q Exactive,time-of-flight,Simoa HD-1 Analyzer,Signa Premier AIR 3T,IlluminaMiSeq,SequenomMultiplex,quadrupole time-of-flight,Q Exactive Plus

Description: The general strategy by which the library was prepared
Method by which library was prepared
The version of the library. For example, rnaSeq 10x library version
The type of library, in assays where samples are barcoded or hashed for multiplexing or each sample has multiple libraries amplified separately before pooled sequencing.
Whether or not the library is stranded
The strand from which the read originates in a strand-specific protocol
The length of the read
The sequencing read types
A set of references (e.g., canonical assembled contigs) which defines a common coordinate space for comparing reference-aligned experimental data.
Conditions under which sample is kept
The minimum counts-per-million (CPM) threshold
Type of analysis
Alignment information
Information about vendor (novagene) processes
The nucleotide sequence of the sample barcode used to identify cells from a single sample in cell hashing or multiplexing assays.
RNA Integrity Number
Batch in which RNA sample was isolated
The technology used to isolate the RNA
Batch library was prepared in
Batch library was sequenced in
Total number of raw sequencing reads from a library
Fraction of reads with cell barcodes that match the whitelist
Number of cells or nuclei sequenced
The median number of genes detected (with nonzero UMI counts) across all cell-associated barcodes
Defined format of the data file, typically corresponding to extension, but sometimes indicating more general group of files produced by the same tool or software
Further qualification of dataType, which may be used to indicate the state of processing of the data, aggregation of the data, or presence of metadata.
A cell phenotype that consists of the cell's disposition to survive and develop normally. Provided as number of live cells per unit volume
Ratio of absorbance at 230 nm and 260 nm. Measures protein or other contaminants. Range up to approximately 2.2.
Measure of DNA vs. RNA purity. Range up to approximately 2.0.
The number of unique genes
Mapped reads refer to those reads from the sequenced sample that align directly to a single region (set of loci) on the reference genome.
The percentage of rRNA in a cell
The total number of unmapped reads from the sequenced sample to a single region (set of loci) on the reference genome.
Types of input/output data in bioinformatics pipelines
Kit serial number
A method to determine the quality of RNA obtained from a sample. DV200 evaluates the percentage of fragments of greater than 200 nucleotides.
The duplication rate is the fraction of mapped reads where any 2 reads share the same 5_ and 3_ coordinates.
Files containing raw bulk RNA sequencing data (fastq) or aligned sequence files that include all unmapped reads (bam, cram)
Files containing bulk RNA count matrix data
Metadata files include clinical and biospecimen metadata
The type of resource being stored and annotated
For files of dataSubtype: metadata, a description of the type of metadata in the file.
Tissue type used in sample
The median number of total Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) counts across all cell-associated barcodes
A cell phenotype that consists of the cell's disposition to survive and develop normally.
Percent mitochondria per cell
The predicition of sex based on expression of genes
